intro: Habranthus phycelloides, commonly known as the silverleaf habranthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking silver-green foliage. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is often cultivated in subtropical and Mediterranean climates.
